column1: jsonform,Build forms from JSON Schema. Easily template-able. Compatible with Bootstrap 3 out of the box.

Updated the binding of changes when using a legend. Changes were not reflected when the text field was using an enum unless you used they keyboard to scroll through the different options. Below is a sample form that has a legend with an array and text enum. Verified this works with an existing legend that is tied to a standard text box.
Drag drop will update template {{values}} data"

abhinav-upadhyay,2014-01-29 11:19:15,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/ab2322df51d8704ee365b589c23d6a6c3ad66e4d,ab2322df51d8704ee365b589c23d6a6c3ad66e4d,"Fix a minor bug in the playground app, resulting in 404's in some cases.
For some reason, the browser keeps appending a trailing '/' at the end
of the URLs. Since the loadExample function in playground.js parses the
request parameter itself and uses it to load the JSON, a trailing '/' at
the end of the URL causes the function to generate a request for a JSON
The PR adds a check for a trailing '/' and taking appropriate action if

jmediajar,2016-05-02 23:39:49,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/4df1c03311240393e4ff9fc97ffaa6cb41cfd4a3,4df1c03311240393e4ff9fc97ffaa6cb41cfd4a3,"Add space character to placeholder string

For each use of thestring `""placeholder=""`, added a space character at the beginning, i.e.`"" placeholder=""`.  Without the space, a compounded string is created if you use the 'placeholder' property.
Generates: ```<input type=""text"" disabledplaceholder=""my place"">``` when it should be, ```<input type=""text"" disabled placeholder=""my place"">```"

steren,2012-04-23 13:11:30,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/32ad0a71a0800f28d2c1666d9931bcd6e1ecc14a,32ad0a71a0800f28d2c1666d9931bcd6e1ecc14a,default values for ACE in JSONform

tidoust,2012-04-19 14:36:04,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/5baaaa0928a9cd93e77a262f88800b5cdcf2ab3b,5baaaa0928a9cd93e77a262f88800b5cdcf2ab3b,"Default values only proposed when form's ""value"" property not set.
The library used default values whenever it did not find the key
in the ""value"" object that may be attached to the JSON Form object
to symbolize the results of a previously submitted form.
The problem with that approach is that fields left empty are often
not included in the result (typically the case with checkboxes).
If their default value is not empty, the default value is always
used when the form is rendered. In short, a boolean flag whose
default value is ""true"" always appears as a checked checkbox, no
The change simply takes for granted that default values should only
be used when the form has never been submitted before, in other
words when the ""value"" property is not set.
Note an empty object counts as an actual form submission result
(it means all fields were left empty on purpose)."

tidoust,2012-04-06 21:14:14,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/26a14f7fa59ed2c0b539cf9284afd8656e0b8b4c,26a14f7fa59ed2c0b539cf9284afd8656e0b8b4c,"Fully updated jsonform to generate Bootstrap 2.0 compatible forms
- class names adjusted to fit Bootstrap 2.0 (e.g. 'form-actions'
- radio buttons and checkboxes do not use lists anymore
- JS code that handles 'selectfieldset' sections updated
Update is not backward compatible with Bootstrap 1.4, simply because
Bootstrap 2.0 is not backward compatible with Bootstrap 1.4.
Overall, the code generated is cleaner than the previous version."

tidoust,2012-03-15 13:27:16,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/88bb4b670a5472cd167fb12b1049e8bb6a87c162,88bb4b670a5472cd167fb12b1049e8bb6a87c162,Small update to make the library more resilient to invalid JSON Form objects.

tidoust,2012-03-13 13:18:13,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/471034fbef79b954e435b4a7432766d2073e00b2,471034fbef79b954e435b4a7432766d2073e00b2,"Added support for arrays with ""complex"" structures.
JSON Form now supports arrays whose items can follow an arbitrarily
complex structure (as opposed to being restricted to simple types
The important point to get is that references to array elements
from the form layout section must include [], e.g.:
1/ Items in an array must all be of the same type. In other words,
the ""items property in the data schema for the array element must
either be an object or an array with one element. For instance:
2/ Arrays cannot be nested for the time being.
3/ Similarly, a checkboxes section cannot be nested with an array."

tidoust,2012-03-12 12:42:58,https://api.github.com/repos/jsonform/jsonform/git/commits/109374cf99d06a8db0ae96ddb5ef291b8865bcda,109374cf99d06a8db0ae96ddb5ef291b8865bcda,"Added support for ""expandable"" fieldsets and ""selectfieldset"" tabs.
When a fieldset is defined as ""expandable"" (boolean property), the
section is collapsed by default and may be expanded with a click.
The code includes the JavaScript code to collapse/expand the section.
It also adds an ""expandable"" class to the generated section for
styling purpose (e.g. to add an arrow next to the fieldset legend
to provide a visual clue that the section can be expanded). See
selectfieldset"" is a new type of form sections that should be used
for alternatives that are more complex than ""pick up an element in
the list"". It's typically useful for forms that provide multiple
entry points such as ""search by user name"", ""search by playlist"",
search by text"", etc. The ""selectfieldset"" type is similar to a
fieldset"" in that the same properties are used (""legend"" if needed
and ""items""). It is similar to a ""select"" field in that it provides
an alternative between different choices. Visually, the type is
represented as ""tabs"". Input fields from hidden tabs are disabled
so that they do not appear in the submitted form. Items of a
selectfieldset"" form section must be ""optionfieldset"" items. See
